sub_title: Expert Climate Change, Environment and Peacebuilding
summary:
WHO I AM
- Programme/Project Manager with 10+ years experience in international charity and UN sector
- Technical expert in the areas of environmental sustainability, climate change, disaster risk reduction and resilience, political and security risks, human rights and peacebuilding
- An ambitious, inquisitive, well-travelled and connected person 

WHAT ARE MY TOP 10 SKILLS
(1) Providing strategic direction, (2) Programme/project management, (3) Partnership building/stakeholder management, (4) Community based/management approaches, (5) Policy influencing, (6) Research, (7) Facilitation/training, (8) Authoring reports, guidelines, papers and blogs, (9) Mentoring, and (10) Proposal and report writing

WHAT GEOGRAPHIES HAVE I WORKED
Europe: Belgium, The Netherlands, United Kingdom
Africa: Ethiopia, Kenya, Mali, Somalia, South Sudan, Sudan, Tanzania, Uganda, Zimbabwe
Asia: Bangladesh, Cambodia, Pakistan, Philippines, Vietnam
Central Asia: Kazachstan, Kyrgyzstan
Latin America/Caribbean: El Salvador, Haiti, Nicaragua

profile_positions.description:
International Alert is a peacebuilding organisations working in more than 25 countries We aim to address the root causes of conflict, bringing together people from across divides. Alert seeks to influence the policies and engagement strategies of governments, international organisations and practitioners to reduce conflict risks and support cooperative initiatives for lasting peace.

I am leading Alert's work on climate security and conflicts around access and protection of land, water and forests. The aim is to enhance opportunities within fragile contexts for communities to build social resilience and adaptability in the face of the linked risks of climate change, natural resources and conflict. To this end, my goal is to ensure that environment and climate change considerations are factored into development, conservation  and peacebuilding policy and practice, and that conflict sensitivity is integrated into natural resource management and responses to climate change. I am managing research and advocacy projects at the global level and support country offices in design and implementation of projects with communities, governments and businesses.
profile_positions.title: Head of Climate Change Natural Resource Management and Peacebuilding

profile_positions.description:
ActionAid is an international organisation working with poor and marginalised people to reduce poverty by overcoming the injustice and inequity that cause it.

I lead on resilience programme across 23 countries in Africa and Asia. This includes strategy development, engaging and influencing internal/external stakeholders, and proving high-level technical assistance. Working closely with ActionAid's humanitarian team, I ensure humanitarian response includes strategies for recovery and 'building back better'. In addition, I manage different multi-country projects that aim to improve the organisation's learning and programming on building the disaster and climate change resilience of communities in developing countries and contexts of protracted crisis. 

The multi country projects focus on (1) improving the disaster resilience of growing urban populations in African cities, (2) understanding and developing approaches to build resilience of most vulnerable populations living in protracted crisis, and (3) developing an research methodology to assess loss and damage as a result of climate change in Asia.
profile_positions.title: Resilience Programme Manager

profile_positions.description:
HelpAge is a unique organisation drawing the attention of policy makers and practitioners to global demographic change. HelpAge's programmes aim to support ageing populations around the world to claim their rights, overcome poverty and challenge discrimination. 

My responsibility was to develop and manage HelpAge’s global strategy and programme on resilience building, including Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Climate Change Adaptation (CCA).

My duties include:
• Providing technical support to country offices in Asia, Africa and Latin America to assure quality of DRR and CCA project proposals and implementation.
• Seeking partnership with likeminded NGOs and establishing consortiums.
• Influencing policy makers and practitioners on including ageing populations in resilience building.
• Developing and managing cross organisational learning processes.
• Organising campaigning and advocacy events for the occassion of the International Day for DRR 2014.

Milestones:
• Authored a 45 page publication titled “Disaster resilience in an ageing world. How to make policies and programme age-inclusive” to be used for advocacy purposes.
• Realised the growth of the DRR and CCA portfolio from 13 to 15 countries in one year.
• Established a formal partnership with UNISDR for the International Day for DRR 2014 which resulted in an invitation to co-write the official message on behalf of the UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon.
profile_positions.title: Disaster Risk Reduction & Resilience Advisor

profile_positions.description:
UNMISS is the UN peacekeeping mission to the Republic of South Sudan that supports the South Sudan governments in peace- and statebuilding through i.e. build their capacity to provide security, to establish rule of law, and to strengthen the security and justice sectors.

During this temporary role I supported government authorities in Eastern Equatoria by building their capacity in development planning and implementation.

My duties included:
• Providing advice and direct support to various provincial ministries and county officials in developing strategies and resource mobilisation. 
• Field missions to remote counties to monitor and discuss the security and human rights situation with county commissioners, police and military leadership.
• Monitoring the project activities of UNDP, UNICEF and other UN agencies in counties where they do not have a physical presence.
• Managing "Quick Impact Projects" at county level that were aimed to consolidate peace through strategic livelihoods activities.

Milestones:
• Led the formulation of a natural resource management strategy that resulted in the State Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Natural Resources securing funding with donors like FAO.
• Successfully managed two projects and overcame immense challenges in terms of logistical delays and negotiating support from local authorities.
• Reports of my field missions on cases of 'girl-child compensation' resulted in increased discussions with the State Governor to address this practice of human rights violation. The Governor condemned this practice on the radio and during other public events.
profile_positions.title: Recovery and Peacebuilding Manager

profile_positions.location: South Sudan l Kenya l Somaliland l Puntland
profile_positions.description:
CARE International is one of the largest and oldest humanitarian organisations fighting global poverty through emergency relief and long-term development in a broad range of themes.

During this contract role I developed and managed CARE’s strategy and programme on resilience building, including Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and natural resource management in Somalia and South Sudan.

My duties included:
• Providing advice and guidance to the country offices on increasing the resilience of communities through i.e. conducting disaster risk assessments, development of a DRR mainstreaming strategy.
• Organised and facilitated DRR and Do No Harm trainings for staff and partner organisations.
• Proposal writing.
• Managing a research project, including 3 academic researchers, aimed to assess the impact of climate change on pastoralists in Northern Somalia and their coping strategies.
• Liaising with development partners to establish collaboration in fields of DRR and CCA.

Milestones:
• The findings of the study on pathways to sustainable pastoralism in Northern Somalia resulted in measures taken by local governments, communities and donors to develop and implement sustainable livestock production and rangeland management practices.
• Trained 75 staff and partner organisations on DRR which resulted in mainstreaming of risk assessments and DRR measures in WASH and livelihoods projects which increased the sustainability of the projects.
profile_positions.title: Disaster Risk Reduction Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Cordaid is a large Dutch NGO that aims to bring about transformation in societies around the world so that they become more just, more inclusive and more sustainable. My time with the organisation was shared between two departments: Initially with the Food Security & Entrepreneurship Department but following the earthquake in Haiti in January 2010 I joined the Emergency & Reconstruction Department.

My role as Programme Officer included the responsibility of relationship management of partner organisations in Ethiopia, Haiti and Zambia.

My duties included:
• Providing continuous support to partner organisations in the design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of their projects focusing on smallholder farming and emergency response.
• Developing and managing the recovery livelihoods and health programme in Haiti following the earthquake in 2010.
• Research and drafting a context analysis of Ethiopia as part of an internal future fit process.
• Research for the development of a policy on access to markets in fragile states.

Milestones:
• Showcased good logistics management, stakeholder management and conflict mediation skills to ensure success of an important partner consultation in Haiti.
• Took initiative to change the mode of working of dioceses in Zambia by persuading them to adopt a capacity building model and reduce unnecessary free hand-outs, hence reducing aid-dependence.
profile_positions.title: Programme Officer

profile_positions.description:
Heyde Consultancy is a small Belgian consulting company offering high-quality expertise in a large scope of sectors within development cooperation.

As Junior Consultant I frequently supported a Senior Consultant in a large variety of assignments. These include among others:
• Assessing project proposals for the Food Facility of the European Commission.
• Conducting research for Rwanda’s gender profile that I drafted for the African Development Bank.
• Analysing and compiling qualitative and quantitative data for the evaluation of a technical and vocational education and training programme in Kenya for the Dutch NGO ICCO.
profile_positions.title: Junior Consultant

company.name: Centro de Intercambio y Solidaridad in El Salvador

profile_positions.company: Centro de Intercambio y Solidaridad in El Salvador
profile_positions.description:
Centro de Intercambio y Solidaridad (CIS) is a non-profit organization in El Salvador with programmes supporting education, social justice, and democratisation.

As Election Observer I reported on the municipal and parliamentary elections including the campaigning period in 2009. To this end, I interviewed with representatives of political parties, human rights organisations and the electoral board.
profile_positions.title: Election Observer

profile_positions.description:
As Junior Policy Officer with the Department of Development Cooperation I was responsible for policy development and relation management of partner organisations in the thematic areas of gender, reproductive health and HIV/AIDS.

My duties included:
• Conducting research on the HIV/AIDS epidemic in fragile states to inform the Ministry’s policy.
• Assessing programme proposals, annual reports and evaluations of partner organisations.
• Reviewing mid-term reviews and evaluations of partner organisations’ programmes.
• Organising internal and external workshops and presenting the HIV/Aids policy of the Ministry.
profile_positions.title: Policy Officer

profile_positions.description: As Research Intern I studied the viability of sustainable peace and political transition in Sudan and identified the main impediments and possibilities. To this end, I interviewed representatives of political parties, academic institutions and international organisations.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern
